description: From Afrikaans kop, from Dutch kop, from Middle Dutch cop.

examples: A party of burghers, under Commandant Nel, of Kroonstad, were ordered to station themselves on a kop with a flat top, called Swartbooiskop, an hour and a half to the south of Nicholson's Nek.

entries.meaning: Rare spelling of cop (“dome, in armor”).
examples: The solerets are wide-toed,  […] ; the wings of the elbow and knee-kops small. The inner bends of the elbow joints are furnished with a pliable protection of numerous very narrow plates.
